newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Ciba Specialty posts 1996 H1 loss.
newsitem.headline: Ciba Specialty posts 1996 H1 loss.

text.p: Ciba Specialty Chemicals, which is being spun off from Novartis AG, said it had a 1996 first half net loss of 615 million Swiss francs compared with a profit of 303 million in the same period of 1995.
However, the company expected a marginal increase in operating profits before restructuring and one-time charges for the full year 1996.

The company also said restructuring costs and special charges during the 1996 six-month period totalled 1.077 billion Swiss francs and further restructuring charges of between 250 million and 300 million francs were expected for 1997.
Under the spin-offer agreement Ciba Specialty also assumes one billion Swiss francs of net debt. This, it said, compares favourably with more than four billion francs of equity.

In addition, it said the 1996 restructuring charges comprise 202 million Swiss francs of additional environmental provisions transferred to Ciba Specialty and 340 million Swiss francs to cover separation costs.
The remaining 535 million Swiss francs is being used for streamlining Ciba Specialty Chemicals' divisional operations.
